sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: Most product teams commonly adopt a feature-centric mindset, finding them convenient for brainstorming, drafting requirement documents, and integrating into backlogs and ticketing systems. In this article, Andy Budd shows how fixation with features might be holding you back and how making a few small tweaks to your process could make an entire world of difference.
articles.title: The Feature Trap: Why Feature Centricity Is Harming Your Product

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: Language models have shown impressive capabilities. But that doesn’t mean they’re without faults, as anyone who has witnessed a ChatGPT “hallucination” can attest. In this article, Joas Pambou diagnoses the symptoms that cause hallucinations and explains not only what RAG is but also different approaches for using it to solve language model limitations.
articles.title: A Simple Guide To Retrieval Augmented Generation Language Models

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yair Even Or)
articles.description: Taking inspiration from shadows, author Yair Even Or creates the same sort of thing, only with a blurring effect in place of the shadow. Read along for a step-by-step explanation of how it comes together using a combination of masks, gradients, and the good ol’ `backdrop-filter` property.
articles.title: CSS Blurry Shimmer Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Filip Paldia & Jamie Clarke)
articles.description: AI promises a major upheaval in typography, with designers finding themselves navigating both opportunities and challenges. How will it impact quality, design roles, and our use of type in the future? As we explore this new frontier, we realise that we are at a juncture as significant as Gutenberg’s press, set to redefine how we interact with text and visual communication.
articles.title: The AI Dilemma In Graphic Design: Steering Towards Excellence In Typography And Beyond

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: The CSS `border-image` property is one of those properties you undoubtedly know exists but may not have ever reached for. In this article, Temani Afif demonstrates different approaches for using `border-image` to create clever decorative accents and shapes.
articles.title: The Complex But Awesome CSS border-image Property

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2023

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Are you ready for a little exercise of pulling a framework apart and putting the pieces back together? In this article, Atila Fassina explains how meta-frameworks have evolved around core libraries in their own unique ways.
articles.title: SolidStart: A Different Breed Of Meta-Framework

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the second half of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece expands on the demos from the first article to demonstrate how the View Transitions API can be used to transition not just elements between two states but the transition between full views and pages in single-page and multi-page applications.
articles.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 2)

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Are you gearing up for a job interview in the deep learning field? Look no further!  We just published a video course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that is specifically designed to prepare candidates for deep learning job interviews, covering 50 common interview questions with detailed explanations. Tatev Aslanyan
articles.title: Ace Your Deep Learning Job Interview

articles.author: Reed Barger
articles.description: Have you looked at interactive dashboards on websites like Stripe and thought, “How can I build something like this myself?” In this full-stack React and Next.js project, you’ll learn how to build a stunning admin dashboard from front to back. Our final admin dashboard will allow you to display and
articles.title: How to Build an Admin Dashboard with React

articles.author: Hunor Márton Borbély
articles.description: In this JavaScript game tutorial, you'll learn how to create a modern version of the 1991 classic game Gorillas using plain JavaScript and the HTML canvas element. In this game, two gorillas throw explosive bananas at each other, and the first one to hit the other one wins the game.
articles.title: JavaScript Game Dev Tutorial – Build Gorillas with HTML Canvas + JavaScript

articles.author: Muhammad Haseeb
articles.description: Deploying a Django application can be streamlined and automated using GitHub Actions. This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to set up a continuous deployment pipeline for a Django project hosted on an AWS EC2 instance. By leveraging GitHub Actions, developers can automate their deployment process, making it more
articles.title: How to Deploy Your Django Project on an EC2 Machine using GitHub Actions

articles.author: Benjamin Semah
articles.description: In JavaScript, every value has a boolean equivalent. This means it can either be evaluated as true (truthy value) or false (falsy value) when used in a boolean context.  But what is a boolean context? It's a situation where a boolean value is expected. Examples include if statements, logical
articles.title: What are Falsy Values in JavaScript? Explained with Examples

articles.author: Oluwadamisi Samuel Praise
articles.description: Steve Lohr of The New York Times said: "Data scientists, according to interviews and expert estimates, spend 50 percent to 80 percent of their time mired in the mundane labor of collecting and preparing unruly digital data, before it can be explored for useful nuggets."  This statement is 100%
articles.title: How to Use Pandas for Data Cleaning and Preprocessing

articles.author: Dhawal Shah
articles.description: If you haven’t heard, universities around the world are offering their courses online for free (or at least, partially free). These online courses [https://www.classcentral.com/help/intro-to-online-learning] are collectively called MOOCs or Massive Open Online Courses. [https://www.classcentral.com/help/moocs] In the past ten years or so, over 1000 universities have created more than 20,000 such
articles.title: 200+ Universities Just Launched 1000+ Free Online Courses. Here’s the Full List.

articles.author: Grant Riordan
articles.description: When you're working with .NET, interacting with databases – particularly SQL databases – is inevitable. The common approaches involve ORM (Object Relational Mapping) tools like Entity Framework (EF Core) or Dapper. Dapper excels in speed and control for CRUD operations. This article explores Dapper's suitability for performance-critical .NET projects with simpler
articles.title: How to Use Dapper in Your .NET Projects

articles.author: Abraham Dahunsi
articles.description: The NVIDIA Compute Unified Device Architecture (CUDA) Toolkit is a software platform that allows developers to tap into the computing power of NVIDIA processing and GPU-accelerated applications. CUDA is also a programming model and an API that enables programmers to write code that can run on both the CPU and
articles.title: How to Install NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit on Ubuntu

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: We just published a great beginner's web dev tutorial on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of several core technologies, including Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript, all while creating a practical, real-world project. Core Technologies Used You will improve your skills
articles.title: Beginner Web Dev Tutorial – Build a Weather App with Next.js & TypeScript
